topic.para: Welcome to Other Maemo Weather.
Other Maemo Weather (OMWeather) is a weather applet for Nokia Internet Tablets. It can be used to:

list.listitem: Check detailed weather forecast for up to 10 days
Automatically to update weather information from the Internet (Data available from xoap.weather.com)
Configure closest weather station automatically using GPS
Easily to select custom weather station from the sorted drop down menu
See sunrise and sunset times for selected weather stations
See current phase of the Moon
Select between different icon sizes, icon sets, colors and view modes
See some eye candy with transparency option

topic.para: Use the to use the various sections of this help document.
To activate OMWeather select Home Select applets... OMWeather.

First thing to do is select the position of a OMWeather applet in home view. You can change applets position simply touching it and dragging it where you want it. Appearance of the applet can be changed from the Interface tab in OMWeather settings window.

OMWeather will use Tablets Home city selection as a default location for weather data. This location can be changed by touching the applet and selecting Settings and then Locations tab. GPS functionality can be also enabled from this tab.
More info of how to change appearance of the applet and add, rename and delete locations can be found on page.

The Settings dialog (accessible from the desktop applet or home views Applet settings menu) provides access to the configurable options that control how OMWeather appears and run. In addition to the tabs, there are also a About button to show information of the OMWeather.
Locations tab lists all locations which weather data OMWeather will receive when applets refresh button is touched or automatic update happens.
Add button allows you to add new weather stations, which will then be listed in the locations screen.
Rename button allows you to change name of the selected station.
Delete button deletes selected station from the list.
Up and down arrows allows you to change the order of the selected locations.
Enable station from GPS: check box is used to enable automatic weather station selection when ever GPS is enabled.
Interface tab is used to configure settings that controls visual appearance of the OMWeather.
Visible items: selects how many icons will be shown in the tablets home screen. Possibilities go from 1 to 10.
Layout: selects how icons are shown in the home screen. Possible selections are one row, one column, two rows, two columns or combinated.

Icon set: selects which icon set is used. You can install more icon sets with the application manager (if Maemo extras repository is configured) or going to OMWeathers Maemo garage page (http://omweather.garage.maemo.org/) and downloading icon sets directly from there.
Icon size: defines icon size. Size can be tiny, small, medium, large or giant.
Font color: defines applets font color. Touching color button will open Pick a Color dialog where it's possible to select font color.
Background color: setting defines used background color for icons. Color selection works same way as selecting font color. Background color is not selectable if transparency is used.
Transparency: selection will show background image behind the icons.
Show only current weather on first icon: selection will show current weather on first icon and forecast for a rest of the day is shown on the next icon.
Hide station name: selection will controls if station name are shown on the applet.
Hide arrows: selection will controls if arrows used to change weather station are shown on the applet.
Units tab is used to select temperature, distance and wind speed units shown on weather data. Used units can be selected from a drop down menus.
Swap hi/low temperature: selection will change way how lowest and highest temperature for a day is shown on the applet. If selected, applet will show high temperature first.
Update tab is used to configure update interval of a weather data. This tab shows also time when next update will be done.
Automatically updating data after connect to Internet: selection will controls if weather data is automatically updated when Internet connection is established.
Switch to the next station after: drop down menu controls time after applet changes to next weather station.
Valid time for current weather and update interval can be selected from a drop down menu.
In this window you need to select first a country from a drop down menu. Next you need to select correct state or province (only some countries) and a place which weather you want to monitor.
Add Custom Station button is used to add weather stations not found on drop down menus.

This window you need to enter station name and station code for a custom weather station. Station codes can be found from the (http://xoap.weather.com/search/search?here=station_name) or you can use ZIP code for US stations.
Touching icon of a day brings up a small windows where you can see current weather or detailed forecast of a selected day. Touching Settings button will open OMWeather settings dialog.
To manually update weather data select refresh button from the detailed weather window (two small arrows in the upper right corner).
To see time of the sunrise/sunset or current phase of the moon select >> in the current/detailed weather window. This window will also show last update times of the weather data.
